page.title: 07 GROVE MANOR FARM -THE MOAT
page.content: Mr Vincent told us about all the history of the farm.First he showed us a little island and all round it was a moat. He told us that when he was our age he had a tub of water with six goldfish but eventually the war broke out and he had to be evacuated to another town,so he poured the six goldfish into the moat and ever since then they have survived and now there are hundreds. Every night a heron comes to the moat and takes one or two fish. He also told us about the Danes.When they invaded,the people of the farm ran onto the island and lifted up the drawbridge.The Danes couldn't stay long because they had to leave with the next tide.At that time the sea came right up to the farm. Sometimes they find shells in the soil still. Chequer Court,Ash,also has a moat which is now dry and there is a Moat Farm in Ash.
